page.title: 08Living in Swinbrook - 1985
page.content: Few of the indigenous population still live in the parish of Swinbrook.The majority are professional people,many of whom are retired.Many cottages form second or weekend accommodation so that owners seldom take part in village life.With only six children of school age and under and few young adults Village Hall activities like the Women's Institute and Bingo are largely supported by folk from other villages. The Cricket Club prospers with five Swinbrook residents playing for the team.The church draws its congregation from adjoining parishes as well as from Swinbrook.A bi-monthly magazine the Â£Swinbrook Chronicle' forms the information link between a scattered community.Papers are delivered six days and milk three days a week.Mr. Fish on Wheels and the greengrocer come once a week and the Mobile Library fortnightly
